ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed a better understanding of the political economy literature, as well as of the techniques and methods used in empirical analysis of important political economy-focused questions.
Critical reading of quantitative papers; writing referee reports and presentation techniques Great overview of empirical political economy literature

Professor Washington was very helpful in showing us how to approach an academic paper critically. There are clear patterns in how to present strengths and weaknesses in a paper, which she helpfully pointed out. She also provided recent works in political economy, which was very informative.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The discussions were very useful and forced me to engage deeply with the material. However, sometimes it felt that only a few students spoke during discussion. Perhaps it would be best to assign a paper to each student to focus on so that all students speak similar amounts. Moreover, sometimes we would prioritize papers that I found less interesting than others during a given week. Perhaps it would be useful to ask the class at the outset which papers they would like to prioritize (although that sometimes occurred and students simply differed in opinion).

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This is a great course for anyone who wants to specialize in political economy. The specificity of the discussions of weekly readings forced us to understand exactly what the paper was doing, so as to better our own ability as researchers.
Yes, this is a great course to delve both into the methods and theory sections of empirical PE papers.
